main event: A star-shaped, silver object the size of a pin head was observed in the sky over Charleston, South Carolina.
interesting points: The object was observed turning from northwest to south and disappearing from view.
The sighting was made by naked eye observation at 2312 Zulu on July 28, 1965.
The observers were on the campus of The Citadel in Charleston, South Carolina.
A previous UFO sighting had been reported in the same area on July 12, 1965, but checks with appropriate agencies were negative.
The preparing officer considered the information doubtful and did not obtain detailed weather information.
witnesses: civilian observers on the campus of The Citadel
